div.l: Daunce he couþe so well And Iolyfye
That he was clepede ꝑperkyn reuelour
He was as Fulle of loue ⁊and ꝑparamoure
As is the hyue Fulle of honye swete
Welle was þe wenche with hym myghte mete
Atte euerye brydale wolde he Synge ⁊and hopp̄e
He louede bette þe tauerne þan the schopp̄e
For whan þ̉er enye rydenge was in Chepe
Owte of þe Schopp̄e þydder wolde he lepe
Tylle þat he hadde All the syghte ysayene
And dauncede well wolde he notte come agayne
And gaderede hym A Mayne of his sorte
To hopp̄e ⁊and synge And maken Sucche disporte
And þ̉er they setten steuene For to Mete
To pleyen Atte dyse in Suche A strete
For in the towne was þ̉er no prentyse
That Fayrer couþe caste A payer of dyse
Than ꝑperken couþe And þ̉erto he was Fre
Of his dispence in place of p̉riuyte
That Fonde his Maystre well in his chaffare
For offte tyme he Fonde his boxe Fulle bare
For Sykerlye A prentyse reuelour
That haunteþe dyse Ryotte or ꝑparamoure
His Mayster schall hitt in his schopp̄e abye
All haue he no parte of the Mynstralcye
For þeffte and Ryotte þey bene conủertible
All conne he playe on gytirne or Rubible
Reuelle and trouþe as in A lowe degree
They bene Fulle wroþe All daye as Men maye see
This iolye p̉rentise with his Maystre bode
Tylle he were nyghe owte of his p̉rentyshode
All were snybbede boþe erelye And late
And some tyme ladde with Reuelle to Newgate
